content.description:
It's a traverse, so move right to left or left to right as much as your forearms can take. If you're a beast, go no legs! The problem is simple:

From left to right: beginning at

Jeanette's

, stay no higher than 7 feet off the ground, and traverse right until you are under the roof and the holds disappear.
content.protection: A pad would be sweet but optional.
content.location:
From left to right: beginning at

Jeanette's

, stay no higher than 7 feet off the ground, and traverse right until you are under the roof and the holds disappear.

content.description:
This is an open project. It is NOT V-easy.

This ascends a difficult roof crack that

really

needs epoxy for a juggy hidden lip to use for FA. Please don't break this off.
content.protection: 3 or four beefy pads and eight hands.
content.location:
This is an obvious, finger/thin hand, roof crack left of the start of

American Tour

.

content.description:
Jeanette's ascends a nice crack system in dihedral with face holds on either side. Exit left to anchors of

Girls on Stage

or right to anchors of

Elanor's

.
content.location:
This is the corner/crack system between

Girls on Stage

and

Elanor's

.

content.description: Move left and up on balancy slopers and big horizontals, then go right over hard mantel and up.
content.protection: Pro. It needs a bolt for mantel move.
content.location:
Where trail reaches the cliff, go left under a roof to a flat spot. It is left of

Jeanette's

dihedral.

content.description: From flake just to the right of the dihedral, gain stance to mostly positive holds over bulges. Hard move at the end.
content.location: Clean, vertical face to the left of the Chipette Overhang.

content.description: Edges to small, left-facing corner, up to good stances then left and over steeper moves to ledge.
content.location: Clean vertical face to the left of the Chipette Overhang.

content.description:
There are two short but fun starts to choose from:

Aussie Left starts under a big roof and goes up and right on big holds, using a horizontal crack and holds above your head to go over the lip to gain the 1st ledge.

Aussie Right starts under a big roof goes up through an awkward, flaring, wide crack using edges to gain the 1st ledge. From this ledge, step right over loose block, and the route goes over big holds to next ledge.

To the anchors: on the ledge, go left to the anchor of

Brittany's

.
Traverses left past two cracks and bolt, then up trending right over big holds to top with anchors out right.
content.location: Begins at far right of overhang.
